CompilationError.why: Source code has syntax errors, type mismatches, or missing declarations
fix: Check the file and line number in the error message
Verify all includes are present and correct
Check for missing semicolons, brackets, or parentheses
Ensure variable types match their usage
Check for undefined types or forward declarations

LinkerError.what: Linker cannot find function or symbol definition
LinkerError.why: Function declared but not defined, or object file not linked
fix: Ensure all source files are compiled and linked
Verify library paths and library names in linker flags
Check for name mangling issues (extern "C" for C functions)
Verify all object files are included in link command
Use -L for library paths, -l for library names

SegmentationFault.why: Dereferenced null pointer, accessed out-of-bounds array, or use-after-free
fix: Use debugger (gdb) to find the exact location
Check all pointer dereferences for null

TemplateError.what: C++ template instantiation or syntax error
TemplateError.why: Template parameters don't match, missing template keyword, or syntax error
fix: Check template parameter types match requirements
Check for missing 'typename' in dependent types
Use explicit template arguments if needed

MemoryError.what: Memory corruption or invalid access detected
MemoryError.why: Use-after-free, buffer overflow, or double-free detected by sanitizers
fix: Review the sanitizer output for exact location
Check all memory allocations and deallocations
Use smart pointers (unique_ptr, shared_ptr) instead of raw pointers
Check for buffer overflows in array/string operations
Verify new/delete or malloc/free pairs match
Use RAII for automatic memory management

UndefinedBehavior.why: Code invokes undefined behavior (signed overflow, null deref, etc.)

TypeError.why: Types don't match or implicit conversion failed
fix: Check expected vs actual types in error
Add explicit type casts if appropriate

NamespaceError.why: Symbol not found in current namespace or wrong scope
fix: Add using namespace or using declaration

IncludeError.why: Header file not found or include path incorrect
fix: Use angle brackets <> for system headers

ConstError.why: Trying to modify const object or missing const qualifier
fix: Add const qualifier to function if it doesn't modify state
Remove const if modification is needed
Use const_cast only if absolutely necessary
Check for const member function issues
Verify const references are used correctly

VirtualFunctionError.why: Virtual function override issue or inheritance problem
fix: Check virtual function signatures match exactly
Use override keyword to catch mismatches
Verify base class destructor is virtual
Verify pure virtual functions are implemented

ExceptionError.why: Unhandled exception, exception specification mismatch, or throw error
fix: Add try-catch block around throwing code
Use noexcept if function doesn't throw

STLError.why: Invalid iterator, container state, or algorithm usage
fix: Verify container isn't modified during iteration
Use appropriate container for use case

ThreadError.why: Race condition, deadlock, or thread synchronization issue
fix: Use mutexes/locks to protect shared data
Use atomic operations for simple cases
Check for data races with thread sanitizer
Avoid shared mutable state when possible
